alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts, Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 06 at 1:52AM MST until July 07 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHERN MOHAVE COUNTY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 102 IN MOHAVE COUNTY... * TIMING...11 am Thursday until 8 pm MST Friday. * WIND...South to southwest wind 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph both afternoons. Winds will subside during the overnight hours. * HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity values 5 to 10 percent with poor overnight recovery to only 10 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will have the potential to spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is highly discouraged. Area fuels are near or at critical dryness levels further contributing to the high risk of fire danger.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
